result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E Tolbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.
Court deems TIME SERVED.
Concurrent with: 14CM2249

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott E Tolbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court conducts plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 and Count 3 are dismissed and read in.  Case 15FO23 is dismissed and read in. 

Court orders the following:
- 30 days Jail- Court deems time served. Concurrent to 2014CM2249
Jail Inmate Communications form requesting that the Court review the defendant's medical records while incarated. Request is denied by the Court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Sheriff's Department regarding defendant's conduct

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Neither party challenges the doctor's report.  Court accepts the doctor's report and finds the defendant competent to proceed in this matter.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
2 Jail Inmate Communications Forms in regards to the conditions of the jail.
Order for Competency under 971.14(2)
Jail Inmate Communications Form in regards to the defendant's legal representation.
Filed by Attorney Schleis requesting an competency evaluation.
Jail Inmate Communications Form in regards to the defendant's medical treatment.
Jail Inmate Communications Form in regards to the defendant's bail.
Hearing on February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody, with attorney Tedia K. Gamino.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has received discovery on all 3 cases and requests time to review them with the defendant.  Defendant believes he may be able to obtain bail.  Court orders defendant to have 1 free phone call to try to obtain bail.  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Jail Inmate Communications Form in regards to his bail amount.
Hearing on January 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Schleis appeared as a Friend of the Court.  Attorney Schleis has not been appointed to this case yet but expects to be.  Defense requests further proceedings date.  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant to have no contact with Scott E. and Cynthia G. or their residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
